title: TOGAF Part 1 - Foundation Exam
description: 40 questions covering TOGAF fundamentals, ADM phases, and core concepts

questions.text: What does the TOGAF ADM recommend for use in developing an Architecture Vision document?
Which of the following best describes purpose of the Business Scenarios?
Which of the following best describes the class of information known as the Reference Library within the Architecture Repository?
questions.correctAnswer: Guidelines and templates used to create new architectures

questions.text: Consider the following ADM phases objectives. Which phase does each objective match?
Complete the sentence The purpose of the Preliminary Phase is to_____________.

1. What can architects present to stakeholders to extract hidden agendas, principles, and requirements that could impact the final Target Architecture?

2. Presenting different_________and_________to stakeholders helps architects to extract hidden agendas principles and requirements that could impact the final Target Architecture
What is used to structure architectural information in an orderly way so that it can be processed to meet stakeholder needs?
Which of the following best describes the Standards Library?
questions.correctAnswer: A repository area holding specifications to which architectures must conform

questions.text: Which of the following is a responsibility of an Architecture Board?
questions.correctAnswer: Establishing targets for re-use of components

questions.text: In which phase(s) of the ADM would you deal with the actions resulting from a transformation readiness assessment?
Complete the sentence The Enterprise Continuum provides methods for classifying architecture artifacts as they evolve from________________________.

Consider the illustration.
What are the items labelled A, B and C?
questions.correctAnswer: A-Solution Landscape, B-Architecture Requirements Repository, C-Architecture Landscape

questions.text: Which phase of the ADM has the purpose to develop an Enterprise Architecture Capability?
Which statement about Requirements Management is most correct?
questions.correctAnswer: Requirements Management and stakeholder engagement are placed at the center of architecture development.

questions.text:
Consider the following ADM phases objectives.
Which phase does each objective match?
Complete the sentence. The TOGAF standard covers the development of four architecture domains, Business, Data, Technology and __________.

Complete the sentence.
The four purposes that typically frame the planning horizon, depth and breadth of an Architecture Project, and the contents of the EA Repository are Strategy, Portfolio,
What is present in all phases within the ADM and should be identified, classified and mitigated before starting a transformation effort?
Which of the following statements about architecture partitioning is correct?
questions.correctAnswer: Partitions are used to simplify the management of the Enterprise Architecture.

questions.text: Complete the sentence Business Transformation Readiness Assessment is_________________.
questions.correctAnswer: a joint effort between corporate staff lines of business and IT planners

questions.text: Complete the following sentence. In the ADM, documents which are under development and have not undergone any formal review and approval process are called______ Documents which have been reviewed and approved are called ______
What are the four architecture domains that the TOGAF standard deals with?
Which of the following are interests important to the stakeholders in a system?
What is defined as the effect of uncertainty on objectives?
The _____________ ensures that a project transitioning into implementation also smoothly transitions into appropriate Architecture Governance.
What are the four dimensions used to scope an architecture?
questions.correctAnswer: Breadth, Depth, Time Period, Architecture Domains

questions.text: Which section of the TOGAF template for Architecture Principles should - highlight the business benefits of adhering to the principle? - describe the relationship to other principles?
Which statement best describes iteration and the ADM?
questions.correctAnswer: The ADM is iterative, over the whole process, between phases, and within phases.

questions.text: Consider the following descriptions of deliverables consumed and produced across the TOGAF ADM cycle. Which deliverables match these descriptions?
questions.correctAnswer: 1 Architecture Principles - 2 Architecture Requirements Specification - 3 Request for Architecture Work - 4 Statement of Architecture Work

questions.text: Which of the following best summarizes the purpose of Enterprise Architecture?
Consider the diagram showing a classification model for Architecture Landscapes. What are the items labelled A, B and C?
questions.correctAnswer: A-Capability Architecture, B-Segment Architecture, C-Enterprise Strategic Architecture

questions.text: Consider the following ADM phases objectives.

Refer to the table below:
Which ADM Phase does this describe?

Consider the following statement.
Projects may cycle between ADM phases, in planned cycles covering multiple phases.
What does it illustrate?

Consider the graphic illustrating a method supporting the TOGAF ADM.
What does the method help identify?

Complete the sentence.
When considering agile development, Architecture to Support Project will identify what products the Enterprise needs, the boundary of the products, and what constraints a product owner has; this defines the Enterprise's ______________.
Which of the following does the TOGAF standard describe as a package of functionality defined to meet business needs across an organization?
Which of the following supports the need to govern Enterprise Architecture?
questions.correctAnswer: Best practice governance enables the organization to control value realization.

questions.text:
Complete the following sentence.
______________ provide context for architecture work, by describing the needs and ways of working employed by the enterprise.
questions.correctAnswer: Business principles, business goals, and business drivers

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the purpose of the Gap Analysis technique?
questions.correctAnswer: To identify items omitted from the Target Architectur | To identify missing functions | identify potential missing or overlapping functions

questions.text:
Consider the following statements:
1. A whole corporation or a division of a corporation
2. A government agency or a single government department
3. Partnerships and alliances of businesses working together, such as a consortium or supply chain
What are those examples of according to the TOGAF Standard?
Which of the following best describes the TOGAF Architecture Development Method?
questions.correctAnswer: A method for developing and managing the lifecycle of an Enterprise Architecture

questions.text:
Complete the sentence.
Actions arising from the Business Transformation Readiness Assessment technique should be incorporated in the _____________.

Consider the following statement. According to the TOGAF standard, a governed approach of a particular deliverable will ensure  1. adherence to the principles, standards, and requirements of the existing or developing architectures.  2. a system of continuous monitoring to check integrity changes decision-making and audit of all architecture-related activities Which deliverable does this refer to?
Which of the following describes a purpose of Architecture Principles?
questions.correctAnswer: To provide a better understanding about the enterprise's culture and values

questions.text:
What are the following activities part of?
1. Initial risk assessment 
2. Risk mitigation and residual risk assessment
3. Risk monitoring
4. Risk identification
5. Risk Classification
Which of the following statements about architecture partitioning is correct?
questions.correctAnswer: Partitions are used to simplify the management of the Enterprise Architecture.

questions.text:
Consider the following statements.
1. All processes, decision-making, and mechanisms used will be established so as to minimize or avoid potential conflicts of interest.
2. More effective strategic decision-making will be made by C-Level executives and business leaders.
3. All actions implemented and their decision support will be available for inspection by authorized organization and provider parties.
4. Digital Transformation and operations will be more effective and efficient.
Which statements highlight the value and necessity for Architecture Governance to be adopted within organizations?
Which of the following does the TOGAF standard define as the representation of a related set of concerns?
Which of the following best describes purpose of the Business Scenarios?
What should be put in place through organization structures, roles, responsibilities, skills and processes to carry out architectural activity effectively?
Which of the following describes how the Enterprise Continuum is used when developing an enterprise architecture?
questions.correctAnswer: To classify architecture and solution assets

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the Standards Library?
questions.correctAnswer: A repository area holding specications to which architectures must conform.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the need for the ADM process to be governed?
questions.correctAnswer: To verify that the method is being applied correctly.

questions.text: Consider the image showing basic architectural concepts. What are items A and B?
When considering the scope of an architecture, what dimension considers to what level of detail the architecting effort should go?
Which section of the TOGAF template for Architecture Principles should highlight the requirements for carrying out the principle?
Which of the following is a responsibility of an Architecture Board?
Consider the image showing basic architectural concepts. What are items A and B?
Complete the sentence The Architecture Landscape is divided into levels known as__________________________.
Refer to the table below:, Which ADM Phase does this describe?
Complete the sentence A set of architecture principles that cover every situation perceived meets the recommended criteria of_______________
Exhibit. Consider the illustration showing an architecture development cycle Which description matches the phase of the ADM labeled as item 1?
questions.correctAnswer: Operates the process of managing architecture requirements

questions.text: What is presented as ”striking a balance between positive and negative outcomes resulting from the realization of either opportunities or threats?
Which of the following are the four purposes that typically frame the planning horizon, depth and breadth of an Architecture Project, and the contents of the EA Repository-?
Complete the sentence The TOGAF standard covers the development of four architecture domains. Business. Data, Technology and__________________.
What is an objective of the ADM Implementation Governance Phase?
questions.correctAnswer: To ensure conformance for the target architecture

questions.text:
- In which part of the ADM cycle do building block gaps become associated with work packages that will address the gaps?
- In which phase of the ADM cycle do building blocks become implementation-specific?
Why are architecture alternatives and trade-off needed?
questions.correctAnswer: To present different possibilities with their trade-offs to stakeholders

questions.text: What provides context for architecture work, by describing the needs and ways of working employed by the enterprise?
questions.correctAnswer: Business principles business goals, and business drivers

questions.text: Complete the sentence A business scenario describes______________
questions.correctAnswer: business and technology environment in which those problems occur

questions.text: Partnerships and alliances of businesses working together such as a consortium or supply chain
Which of the following is included as part of Architecture Governance1?
questions.correctAnswer: Ensuring compliance with internal and external standards and regulatory obligations

questions.text:
Which of the following statements about architecture partitioning are correct*?

1 Partitions are used to simplify the management of the Enterprise Architecture

2 Partitions are equivalent to architecture levels

3 Partitions enable different teams to work on different element of the architecture at the same time.

4 Partitions reflect the organization's structure

Consider the following statement:
Separate projects may operate their own ADM cycles concurrently, with relationships between the different projects
What does it illustrate?
Which of the following is the ability to develop use and sustain the architecture of a particular enterprise using architecture to govern change?
Complete the sentence The purpose of Enterprise Architecture is to______________.
Which of the following best describes the purpose of the Architecture Roadmap?
questions.correctAnswer: It lists work packages on a timeline showing progress towards the Target Architecture

questions.text: Consider the following chart: Which important concept for Enterprise Architecture Practitioners does it illustrate?
questions.correctAnswer: ADM phases must be run in a sequenced approach to produce the Architecture.

questions.text: Complete the sentence. Actions arising from the Business Transformation Readiness Assessment technique should be incorporated in the
Consider the following ADM phases objectives.

Consider the following statements:
 1. Groups of countries, governments, or governmental organizations (such as militaries) working together to create common or shareable deliverables or infrastructures
2. Partnerships and alliances of businesses working together, such as a consortium or supply chain. 
What are those examples of according to the TOGAF Standard?

Consider the following descriptions of deliverables consumed and produced across the TOGAF ADM cycle.
Which deliverables match these descriptions?
questions.correctAnswer: 1 Architecture Principles -2 Architecture Contracts - 3 Architecture Requirements Specification-4 Request for Architecture Work

questions.text:
Consider the following statements:
1. Each contracted party is required to act responsibly to the organization and its stakeholders.
2. All decisions taken, processes used, and their implementation will not be allowed to create unfair advantage to any one particular party.
3. Digital Transformation and operations will be more effective and efficient.
4. Strategic decision-making by C-Level executives and business leaders will be more effective.
Which statements highlight the value and necessity for Architecture Governance to be adopted within organizations?
Which of the following best describes why the TOGAF Standard is suitable as a framework for Enterprise Architecture?
questions.correctAnswer: It de-risks a technically complex process

questions.text: Complete the sentence: Three of the four architecture domains that are commonly accepted as subsets of an overall Enterprise Architecture are …
Which architecture abstraction level answers why an enterprise undertakes architecture work, and what is the scope of work?
Which of the following is a structural framework that allows an enterprise to distinguish between different types of architectural assets?
Complete the sentence: The Enterprise Continuum provides a classification for …

- Which does the TOGAF Standard define as a collection of organizations that have common goals?
- Which of the following is defined as the highest level (typically) of description of an organization and typically covers all missions and functions?
Complete the sentence: The Enterprise Metamodel defines …
questions.correctAnswer: the types of entities used in models describing the enterprise.

questions.text: Complete the sentence: Risk management is …
questions.correctAnswer: striking a balance between positive and negative outcomes.

questions.text: Which of the following is defined as a specification that has been formally reviewed and agreed upon, that thereafter serves as the basis for further development?
Which of the following is defined as the fundamental concepts or properties of a system in its environment embodied in its elements, relationships, and in the principles of its design and evolution?
What is defined as the statement of difference between two states?
Which of the ADM phases finalizes a detailed plan for moving from the Baseline Architecture to the Target Architecture?
Which of the ADM phases includes customization of the TOGAF framework and definition of Architecture Principles?

Consider the TOGAF ADM graphic of the architecture development cycle:
Select the correct phase names corresponding to Labels 1, 2, and 3.
Refer to Figure 7. Which of the following best describes the ADM graphic?
Which concept does the TOGAF Standard provide to govern the Target Architecture?
Which of the following is an objective of Phase A?
questions.correctAnswer: To develop a high-level vision of the business value to be delivered

questions.text:
Consider the following ADM phases objectives:
Which phase does each objective match?

Refer to the following table:
Which ADM phase(s) does this describe?
Which ADM phase aligns with Agile Software Development?
Which of the following is a purpose of Architecture Principles?
Which of the following statements best describes the Business Transformation Readiness Assessment technique?
questions.correctAnswer: A technique used to understand the readiness of an organization to accept change.

questions.text:
Consider the following diagram:
What is Item 1?

- Where are risks identified as part of the initial Business Transformation Readiness Assesment?
- In which phase of the ADM cycle do building blocks become implementation-specific?
Complete the sentence: The levels of the Architecture Landscape are Strategic, Segment, and …
Why does partitioning help simplify the development of an Enterprise Architecture?
questions.correctAnswer: To enable different teams to work on different elements of an architecture.

questions.text: Complete the sentence: The four purposes of Enterprise Architecture that can be used to frame the planning horizon, depth, and breadth of an Architecture Project, and the contents of the Enterprise Architecture Repository, are Architecture to Support Strategy, Portfolio, Project, and …
What is the practice by which Enterprise Architectures are managed and controlled at an enterprise-wide level?
When considering Architecture Governance, what is the benefit that derives from transparency?
questions.correctAnswer: Actions implemented and their decision support will be available for inspection

questions.text: Complete the sentence by selecting the applicable pair of words: A(n) … is a representation of a system from the perspective of a(n) …
questions.correctAnswer: architecture view, related set of concerns.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the purpose of the Request for Architecture Work?
questions.correctAnswer: It is sent from the sponsor and triggers the start of an architecture development cycle.

questions.text: Which of the following is created in Phase A with the purpose to agree at the outset what the desired outcome should be for the architecture, so that architects can then focus on the detail necessary to validate feasibility?
